ncmimuxConfigEntry.name: ncmimuxConfigEntry
ncmimuxConfigEntry.description: An entry in the ncm IMUX Configuration table.

ncmimuxNIDConfigIndex.name: ncmimuxNIDConfigIndex
ncmimuxNIDConfigIndex.description: This variable indicates the node id value of the node.

ncmimuxLineIndex.name: ncmimuxLineIndex
ncmimuxLineIndex.description: This object is the identifier of a Inter- face on a managed device. If there is an ifEn- try that is directly associated with this it should have the same value as ifIndex. Otherwise, the value exceeds ifNumber, and is a unique identifier following this rule: inside interfaces (e.g., equipment side) with even numbers and outside interfaces (e.g., network side) with odd numbers.

ncmimuxEndId.name: ncmimuxEndId
ncmimuxEndId.description: This value for this object indicates which end of the equipment it is accessing.

ncmimuxIfIndex.name: ncmimuxIfIndex
ncmimuxIfIndex.description: This value for this object is equal to the value of ifIndex from the Interfaces table of MIB II (RFC 1213).

ncmimuxBkplaneBusSelect.name: ncmimuxBkplaneBusSelect
ncmimuxBkplaneBusSelect.description: This object only has signifiance for IMUX 2164. This variable specifies which IMUX line(s) is used, and which backplane bus is assigned to which line(s). The pattern of the the word is compsed as :- line# 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 bus # bus-B B D D B B D D(8) means lines 1,2,5,6 use bus - B lines 3,4,7,8 use bus - D The 'X' means no bus selection has been made.

ncmimuxCarrierLineRate.name: ncmimuxCarrierLineRate
ncmimuxCarrierLineRate.description: This variable specifies whether the carrier line rate is T1 or carrier line is E1.

ncmimuxCarrierLinesEqp.name: ncmimuxCarrierLinesEqp
ncmimuxCarrierLinesEqp.description: This variable indicates the inverse multiplexer carrier lines equipped. One bit per line. Here each bit in this byte represents one of the eight carrier lines that may be used by the Imux. Bit zero represents carrierline number one, and bit seven represents carrier line number eight. For each bit that is set to one, the corresponding carrier line will be configured for use by the ncmimux. For each bit that is set to zero, the corresponding carrier line will be excluded from the ncmimux configuration i.e., 1 = 0000 0001(bin). The range for this variable is from (in decimals 0 to 256).

ncmimuxChanneling.name: ncmimuxChanneling
ncmimuxChanneling.description: This variable indicates the inverse multiplexer mode for T1 which by default is set to 64 Kbps and when the field is set to (1) the 56 kbps mode is selected.

ncmimuxDTEClkTransmit.name: ncmimuxDTEClkTransmit
ncmimuxDTEClkTransmit.description: This field request to determine the DTE data port clock phase is normal or inverted. 'Normal' refers to inverse multiplexer DTE clock phase is normal. 'Inverted' refers to inverse multiplexer DTE clock phase is inverted.

ncmimuxDTEClkRecv.name: ncmimuxDTEClkRecv
ncmimuxDTEClkRecv.description: This field request to determine the DTE data port clock phase is normal or inverted. 'Normal' refers to inverse multiplexer DTE clock phase is normal. 'Inverted' refers to inverse multiplexer DTE clock phase is inverted.

ncmimuxDTEClkRefern.name: ncmimuxDTEClkRefern
ncmimuxDTEClkRefern.description: This field request to determine the DTE data port clock phase is normal or inverted. 'Normal' refers to inverse multiplexer DTE clock phase is normal. 'Inverted' refers to inverse multiplexer DTE clock phase is inverted.

ncmimuxDTEMode.name: ncmimuxDTEMode
ncmimuxDTEMode.description: This variable represents the DTE mode of the ncmimux

ncmimuxDSR.name: ncmimuxDSR
ncmimuxDSR.description: This variable represents Data Set Ready for the ncmimux which could be set for all interfaces.

ncmimuxTM.name: ncmimuxTM
ncmimuxTM.description: This variable represents Test Mode for the ncmimux which could be set for all interfaces.

ncmimuxCTS.name: ncmimuxCTS
ncmimuxCTS.description: This variable represents Clear To Send for the ncmimux which could be set for only V.35, EI530 and RS449 interfaces.

ncmimuxDCD.name: ncmimuxDCD
ncmimuxDCD.description: This variable represents Data Carrier Detect for the ncmimux which could be set for only V.35, EI530 and RS449 interfaces.

ncmimuxRI.name: ncmimuxRI
ncmimuxRI.description: This variable represents Ring Indicator for the ncmimux which could be set for only V.35 interfaces.

ncmimuxSnapType.name: ncmimuxSnapType
ncmimuxSnapType.description: This variable represents the snap type for the ncmimux

ncmimuxQuadSlot.name: ncmimuxQuadSlot
ncmimuxQuadSlot.description: This variable represents the DTE control mode of the ncmimux

ncmimuxStatusEntry.name: ncmimuxStatusEntry
ncmimuxStatusEntry.description: An entry in the IMUX Status table.

ncmimuxNIDStatusIndex.name: ncmimuxNIDStatusIndex
ncmimuxNIDStatusIndex.description: This variable indicates the node id value of the node.

ncmimuxStatusIndex.name: ncmimuxStatusIndex
ncmimuxStatusIndex.description: This object is the identifier of a Inter- face on a managed device. If there is an ifEn- try that is directly associated with this it should have the same value as ifIndex. Otherwise, the value exceeds ifNumber, and is a unique identifier following this rule: inside interfaces (e.g., equipment side) with even numbers and outside interfaces (e.g., network side) with odd numbers.

ncmimuxStatEndId.name: ncmimuxStatEndId
ncmimuxStatEndId.description: This value for this object indicates which end of the equipment it is accessing.

ncmimuxLinesEqp.name: ncmimuxLinesEqp
ncmimuxLinesEqp.description: This variable indicates the inverse multiplexer carrier lines equipped. One bit per line. Here each bit in this byte represents one of the eight carrier lines that may be used by the Imux. Bit zero represents carrierline number one, and bit seven represents carrier line number eight. For each bit that is set to one, the corresponding carrier line will be configured for use by the ncmimux. For each bit that is set to zero, the corresponding carrier line will be excluded from the ncmimux configuration i.e., 1 = 0000 0001(bin). The range for this variable is from (in decimals 0 to 256).

ncmimuxLinesStat.name: ncmimuxLinesStat
ncmimuxLinesStat.description: This represents the lines active equivalent in tabs message, indicating when a carrier line has been allocated for use by the ncmimux. (Loop integrity must be established before the line can be put into active service).Options supported active, inactive or none.

ncmimuxFrameStatus.name: ncmimuxFrameStatus
ncmimuxFrameStatus.description: This variable indicates the ncmimux frame structure is transmitted over each carrier line that has been allocated for use by the ncmimux. This field indicates that this frame structure has been recongnized and validated in the signal received on the carrier line or invalidated.

ncmimuxCTSStatus.name: ncmimuxCTSStatus
ncmimuxCTSStatus.description: This variable indicates Clear To Send status that is encoded into the ncmimux frame structure on each carrier line to indicate that the integrity of the incoming signal has been validated. 'validCTS' refers to Clear To Send indication has been detected in the receive signal on the corresponding carrier line. 'invalidCTS' refers to Clear To send has not been detected. 'none' represents to not supported

ncmimuxCRCStatus.name: ncmimuxCRCStatus
ncmimuxCRCStatus.description: This variable represents the crc error of the incoming frame structure corresponding to a Carrier Line.

ncmimuxFarEndCRCStatus.name: ncmimuxFarEndCRCStatus
ncmimuxFarEndCRCStatus.description: This variable represents the crc error of the incoming frame structure received at the far end of the corresponding Carrier Lines.

ncmimuxDataValidStatus.name: ncmimuxDataValidStatus
ncmimuxDataValidStatus.description: This variable represents the data valid of the Carrier Lines.

ncmimuxNetworkAlarm.name: ncmimuxNetworkAlarm
ncmimuxNetworkAlarm.description: The value for this object indicates the front panel LED alarm status for the network interface.

ncmimuxAlarmLED.name: ncmimuxAlarmLED
ncmimuxAlarmLED.description: The value for this object indicates the front panel LED alarm status for the IMux.

ncmimuxEventMessages.name: ncmimuxEventMessages
ncmimuxEventMessages.description: The value for this object indicates the number of event messages in the event queue. The event queue is a list of state changes which are time-stamped and recorded.

ncmimuxControlEntry.name: ncmimuxControlEntry
ncmimuxControlEntry.description: An entry in the IMUX Control table.

ncmimuxNIDControlIndex.name: ncmimuxNIDControlIndex
ncmimuxNIDControlIndex.description: This variable indicates the node id value of the node.

ncmimuxControlIndex.name: ncmimuxControlIndex
ncmimuxControlIndex.description: This object is the identifier of a Inter- face on a managed device. If there is an ifEn- try that is directly associated with this it should have the same value as ifIndex. Otherwise, the value exceeds ifNumber, and is a unique identifier following this rule: inside interfaces (e.g., equipment side) with even numbers and outside interfaces (e.g., network side) with odd numbers.

ncmimuxCntEndId.name: ncmimuxCntEndId
ncmimuxCntEndId.description: This value for this object indicates which end of the equipment it is accessing.

ncmimuxLoopback.name: ncmimuxLoopback
ncmimuxLoopback.description: This variable represents the Loopback status of Imux, ELB or PLB i.e., Equipment Loop back or Payload loop back.

ncmimuxAISPattern.name: ncmimuxAISPattern
ncmimuxAISPattern.description: This refers to the AIS test pattern initiated

ncmimuxTestPattern.name: ncmimuxTestPattern
ncmimuxTestPattern.description: This refers to the test pattern initiated

ncmimuxDTEStatEntry.name: ncmimuxDTEStatEntry
ncmimuxDTEStatEntry.description: An entry in the IMUX DTEStatus table.

ncmimuxNIDDTEStatIndex.name: ncmimuxNIDDTEStatIndex
ncmimuxNIDDTEStatIndex.description: This variable indicates the node id value of the node.

ncmimuxDTEStatIndex.name: ncmimuxDTEStatIndex
ncmimuxDTEStatIndex.description: This object is the identifier of a Inter- face on a managed device. If there is an ifEn- try that is directly associated with this it should have the same value as ifIndex. Otherwise, the value exceeds ifNumber, and is a unique identifier following this rule: inside interfaces (e.g., equipment side) with even numbers and outside interfaces (e.g., network side) with odd numbers.

ncmimuxDTEStatReg.name: ncmimuxDTEStatReg
ncmimuxDTEStatReg.description: This object reports the contents of the DTE Status Register as read from the IMUX hardware.

ncmimuxDTEStatLPBK.name: ncmimuxDTEStatLPBK
ncmimuxDTEStatLPBK.description: This object reports the DTE Pattern and Loopback Code Register Status. (0) indicates that a Loop Up Code was detected. (1) indicates that Data Pattern or Loop Up Code errors were detected. (2) indicates a Loop Down Code was detected. (3) indicates Loop Down Code Errors were detected. (4) indicates PRBS 2 x 10^25 Aggregate Data Bandwidth.

ncmimuxDTEStatAlarm.name: ncmimuxDTEStatAlarm
ncmimuxDTEStatAlarm.description: This object reports the front panel alarm LED status for the DTE interface.
